description: Triangle of idempotent numbers binomial(n,k)*k^(n-k), version 2.
comments: The inverse triangle is the signed version 1,-2,1,9,-6,1,.. of triangle A061356. - _Peter Luschny_, Mar 13 2009T(n,k) is the sum of the products of the cardinality of the blocks (cells) in the set partitions of {1,2,..,n} into exactly k blocks.From _Peter Bala_, Jul 22 2014: (Start)Exponential Riordan array [(1+x)*exp(x), x*exp(x)].Let M = A093375, the exponential Riordan array [(1+x)*exp(x), x], and for k = 0,1,2,... define M(k) to be the lower unit triangular block array  /I_k 0\  \ 0  M/having the k x k identity matrix I_k as the upper left block; in particular, M(0) = M. The present triangle equals the infinite matrix product M(0)*M(1)*M(2)*... - see the Example section. (End)The Bell transform of n+1. For the definition of the Bell transform see A264428. - _Peter Luschny_, Jan 18 2016
references: L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 91, #43 and p. 135, [3i'].
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Idempotent Number
